page.title: 05POPULATION
page.content: There is a population of 147 including 9 students, 22 schoolchildren and 4 children of preschool age. The village Post Office pays out 23 old age pensions, 11 family allowances, 6 unemployment benefits and 14 others, such as sick benefits. Some old age pensions are not paid through the Post Office. 84 people are Welsh, the rest English. There have been 3 deaths & no births this year. The English and Welsh mix generally in village activities and many of the English learn the Welsh language with varying degrees of success. It is a predominantly aging population. Numbers are increased by holiday makers in summer & children from Dolcorsllwyn are often seen on their walks.
